metadata.synopsis: Dialog with shrine where player can give blessings to gods that do not have their onw statue in Stormshore Tabernacle. Narratively we can say that that money will be spent on getting those gods a space of their own, or another well-intentioned purpose.Only one god will be on the dialog at the same time. And no one will be if a non-cleric character interacts with the shrine and begin the dialog.

19.speaker: Narrator
19.text: *You have defiled a holy place. The gods will speak to you no more.*

71.speaker: Narrator
71.text: *This altar isn't dedicated to a single god, but instead acts as a conduit to many.*

123.speaker: Narrator
123.text: *Your god is one of many, and in this place you sense a spark of its mighty divine flame.*

31.speaker: Narrator
31.text: *As a cleric, you may sacrifice wealth to your deity and expect to receive a boon.*

96.speaker: Narrator
96.text: Think of Bhaal, think of blood.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Think of Bhaal, think of blood.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Bahamut.

101.speaker: Narrator
101.text: *Your soul opens to their divine power.*

70.speaker: Narrator
70.text: *Father claws into your heart and stops it for a single moment. As you begin to fear for your life, you know his love is close.*

106.speaker: Narrator
106.text: *Your Father's power stops your heart for one horrible, terrible moment, then starts it again with the lash of duty.*

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: *Warmth suffuses your body from within as you feel the righteous will of Bahamut, Grandfather of Dragons.*

74.speaker: Narrator
74.text: *Your body and soul shiver with delight as you receive the blessing of Corellon, First of the Seldarine.*

75.speaker: Narrator
75.text: *The blood in your veins beats to the rhythms of Eilistraee as the Dark Dancer's blessing strums you like a lyre.*

22.speaker: Narrator
22.text: *Glitterbright cleric, feel your wits sharpen and muscles harden under the blessing of Garl the Watchful Protector.*

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *Your heart swells with fury and defiance as the iron will of Gruumsh One-Eye infuses you with orcish power! Repay his blessing with blood!*

122.speaker: Narrator
122.text: *Ilmater, the One Who Endures, gently imbues you with the resolve and resignation to persevere through the trials to come.*

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *Doomguide of Kelemvor, receive His blessing: the death of fear, anxiety, and hesitation. For all must die and come to judgement.*

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *Accept Laduguer's blessing of bitter resentment! Count your grievances and draw strength therefrom, for in malice there is power.*

100.speaker: Narrator
100.text: *Be of good cheer, for Lathander the Morninglord blesses you with vigour and joy! 'In the dawn, the way is clear.'*

81.speaker: Narrator
81.text: *You are blessed by Lolth, and her spiderlings of cruelty, lust, and ambition seem to hatch in your chest and skitter along your nerves.*

136.speaker: Narrator
136.text: *Walker, you are blessed by Mielikki, and even here among the stones of the city you smell the fragrance of the forest and feel moss beneath your feet.*

20.speaker: Narrator
20.text: *Moradin seems to hammer your body and soul into a fine-tempered tool wrought to work the will of the Forger. So be it!*

11.speaker: Narrator
11.text: *Oghma the Wise blesses you, and your doubts and fears are replaced by knowledge and insight. Go forth and be judicious.*

149.speaker: Narrator
149.text: *The blessing of Talos empowers you with the surging fury of storm! Fear not, for none can stand against you.*

145.speaker: Narrator
145.text: *Tempus, the Lord of Honourable Battle, calls upon you to confront and defeat your enemies, and blesses you with the will to victory!*

99.speaker: Narrator
99.text: *Blessed by Tiamat, the flame of the Dragon Queen seems to roar in your breast like fire in a furnace. Let your enemies beware!*

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *As Tymora smiles upon you, your fortune and wit are burnished and shine as bright as a new gold coin.*

65.speaker: Narrator
65.text: *Blessed Child of Yondalla, accept her protection and extend her blessing to all who need guidance and guarding.*

156.speaker: Narrator
156.text: *The Lady of Loss blesses you - be troubled by neither memory nor misgiving.*

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Corellon.

148.speaker: Player
148.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Eilistraee.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Garl Glittergold.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Gruumsh.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Ilmater.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Kelemvor.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Laduguer.

137.speaker: Player
137.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Lathander.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Lolth.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Mielikki.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Moradin.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Oghma.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Talos.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Tempus.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Tiamat.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Tymora.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Yondalla.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Shar.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Read what is inscribed on the altar.

91.speaker: Narrator
91.text: *It reads: 'Show your devotion with an offering in your god's name. Blessings may follow.'*

143.speaker: Narrator
143.text: *You offer your paltry gold to the void, like a child at the sweet shop.*

154.speaker: Narrator
154.text: *You offer your paltry gold to the void, like a child at the sweet shop.*

66.text: *There is no response, and you know why - Bhaal will accept the world from you, and nothing less.*

112.speaker: Narrator
112.text: *There is no response, and you know why - Bhaal will accept the world from you, and nothing less.*

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Pay homage and honour to the gods of light and justice.

3.speaker: Narrator
3.text: *The gods are ready to receive your joyful donation.*

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Make an offering to Bahamut, the dragon god of justice.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Make an offering to Corellon the Protector, Creator of the Elves.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Make an offering to Eilistraee, the Dancing Goddess of beauty and freedom.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Make an offering to Garl Glittergold, the bright and clever Father of All Gnomes.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Make an offering to Ilmater, the One Who Endures, god of the oppressed and persecuted.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Make an offering to Lathander the Morninglord, god of vitality, of hope, and of beginnings.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: Make an offering to Mielikki, the Lady of the Forest and Supreme Ranger.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Make an offering to Moradin the Soul Forger, All-Father of the Dwarves.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Make an offering to Yondalla the Blessed, Matriarch of the Halflings.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Choose from another group of deities.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: Seek the wisdom and judgement of the gods of balance and ambiguity.

41.speaker: Narrator
41.text: *The gods are ready to receive your donation.*

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Make an offering to Kelemvor the Great Guide, Lord of the Dead.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: Make an offering to Oghma, Lord of Knowledge and Patron of Bards.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Make an offering to Tempus, God  of War and Lord of Honourable Battle.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Make an offering to Tymora, the Bright Smiling Lady of Luck.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: Seek power and self-justification from the gods of greed and darkness.

103.speaker: Narrator
103.text: *The gods are ready to receive your sacrifice.*

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Make an offering to Gruumsh One-Eye, He Who Watches, God of the Orcs.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Make an offering to Laduguer the Exile, Deity of the Duergar.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Make an offering to Lolth, the Weaver of Destiny and Queen of Spiders and Darkness.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: Make an offering to Talos the Storm Lord, God of Fury and Destruction.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Make an offering to Tiamat, Dragon Queen of Chaos and Avarice.

157.speaker: Tiamat Shrine
157.text: *The amount you've offered proves your piety and devotion. You may now pray here once a day for a divine blessing.*

79.speaker: Narrator
79.text: *The amount you've offered proves your piety and devotion. You may now pray here once a day for a divine blessing.*

6.speaker: Narrator
6.text: *The amount you've offered proves your piety and devotion. You may now pray here once a day for a divine blessing.*

158.speaker: Statue of the Gods
158.text: *The amount you've offered proves your piety and devotion. You may now pray here once a day for a divine blessing.*

139.speaker: Narrator
139.text: *The amount you've offered proves your piety and devotion. You may now pray here once a day for a divine blessing.*

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *Your offering is accepted, but more evidence of devotion is required.*

135.speaker: Player
135.text: Make an offering to Shar, Dark Lady of Loss and Mistress of the Night.
